title: What books are good starting points for studying leftist libertarianism, socialist libertarianism and libertarian Marxism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for the question. There are many excellent ones. Here are a few I would recommend as starters, listed in the order I think would be helpful: An Anarchist FAQDemanding the Impossible - Peter MarshallAn Enquiry Concerning Political Justice - William GodwinThe Ecology of Freedom - Murray BookchinThe Conquest of Bread - Peter KropotkinDavid Graeber - Debt: The First 5,000 YearsWhat is Property - Pierre ProudhonMy 2 cents.
Any book by Rosa Luxembourg for libertarian Marxism, also I believe there was a book by Marx himself I think it was The Civil War in France. Though, please don’t quote me on that, I’m not 100%.
